alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Pickaway; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 9:12PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FAYETTE, WESTERN PICKAWAY AND WESTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM EDT... At 912 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Bainbridge, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Chillicothe, Washington Court House, Williamsport, Bainbridge, New Holland, North Folk Village, Good Hope, Frankfort, Clarksburg, Darbyville, South Salem, Bourneville, Deer Creek Lake, Andersonville, Lattaville, Austin, Knockemstiff, State Route 207 at US Route 22, State Route 138 at US Route 22 and Pancoastburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
